Fields.DialogueText: Sneak attack!
Capitano, you can't just jump on someone like that! Are you trying to scare me half to death?
You're just mad I snuck up on you.
It won't happen again. I was just a little occupied thinking about our special assignment.
Escorting Senator Giovanni, right? We're taking him to some kind of conference to discuss the Morganas.
He must be someone pretty important if he's going. I hear all the world leaders are attending.
You talk like you don't know who he is.
I know his name, not much else. I've never been one for politics, really.

Fields.MenuText: He's il Senatore Giovanni. And you call yourself Italian.
Yeah, I've never cared much for politics either. Too depressing.
Up until I was eleven, I thought "politics" meant "many ticks." Like in a clock.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm plenty Italian. Italy is more than one man with an important job.
Exactly. I'd rather enjoy myself with Nicolina.
... Bwahahaha! Are you serious? That's hilarious! I love that! Poly-ticks, hahahaha!
*ALARM*
Looks like we'll have to talk about politics later. We've got incoming.
And the day was looking so nice, too.
@BATTLE
Capitano, it looks like we have a surprise visitor!
A visitor? Who?
None other than Capitano Lorenzo himself! He says he's here to congratulate you on your victory.
He wants to congratulate me? You sure he's not just disappointed about his loss?
He seemed genuine in his approval. He doesn't seem like a bad man.
You're usually spot on in your assessments. Send him in.
Capitano.
Did I just hear that Lorenzo is here? The same Lorenzo that made Fiorenza go nutso-crazy? I gotta see this guy!
Just don't embarrass me.
Greetings! I'm Capitano Lorenzo, or as my crew calls me, Dio Del Mare - God of the Sea.
Quite the title.
Ha! It fits. I'm not just a pretty face. I possess the most powerful ship in the fleet. Though most people just see my charming smile and forget about that.
You are... charming.

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're... not bad looking.
So it's your picture they added to the dictionary. Next to the word "pompous."
I've seen angler fish with prettier smiles.

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, you can say it. I'm gorgeous.
I've been called worse, but I like the humor. Very clever, Capitano.
Hahaha! Well, much like an angler fish, I do captivate my prey.
... Did you just wink at me?
I'm sorry, was that inappropriate?
I hate to break this up, but Morganas are en route.
Great! Hope you don't mind the company. I'd love to see what this ship can do, since you will be protecting Senator Giovanni and all.
Feel free to stay. You'll see that he'll be in excellent hands.
@BATTLE
We have company! Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Magnificent showing! I see why the Regia Marina chose you.
You might have the firepower, but we beat you in speed.
It's not a competition, you two.
Well, not anymore. You've already won.
Speaking of, I wanted to ask you about Fiorenza. She really wanted you to win. Any idea why?
I've had troubles in the past with manic fans. I'll be the first to admit that she took her obsession to a whole new level. I can't really blame her, though. I mean, look at me.
Oh, I have been.
What was that, Bolzano!?
Nothing. Sorry, Capitano.
Wasn't Fiorenza sentenced to life in some prison somewhere? There's really no need to worry about her anymore.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not worried.
She deserves worse.
The guards better keep a close eye on her.

Fields.DialogueText: Confident as usual, Capitano.
That's dark, but I don't disagree after what she did to Nicolina.
I'm still cautious. She's a dangerous woman.
Silly me! I just realized I still haven't done what I came aboard to do. Congratulations on your victory, Capitano. I look forward to sharing the waters with you.
Same to you.
Now, I must be going. I do have my own ship to attend to, after all.
Weren't you the one telling me not to just jump on someone?
Hehe... Whatever do you mean?
It's a small world. Feel free to drop by anytime!
Might I have a word, Capitano?
Of course.
What did you think about Lorenzo? He's quite the charmer, isn't he?

Fields.MenuText: All I can say for certain is that he lives up to his reputation.
He's real sweet. Too sweet. Like eating nothing but candy for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Bolzano might be falling for his tricks, but I'm not so quick to swoon.

Fields.DialogueText: He seemed like a good man to me. Certainly feeds his ego, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.
Being sweet isn't a bad thing, Capitano. Maybe you should try it sometime.
Tricks? Are you sure you aren't just seeing shadows where there aren't any?
Did you just want to gush about Lorenzo for a bit, or was there something else, Amadeo?
Yes. I wanted to remind you that the Senator arrives soon.
Right. We'd better prepare the ship for his arrival.
My thoughts exactly, Capitano!
*ALARM*
So much for that idea...
Who ever said war was convenient?
@BATTLE
He's here! Giovanni has arrived!
The day is finally here. Oh, it's just hitting me. I'm going to shake the hand of the Senator.
I'm glad you're so excited, Capitano. You earned this.

Fields.MenuText: Not alone. I had your help.
I did, didn't I? I worked hard for this.
You're right. He should be excited to meet me.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, shucks, you're gonna make me blush.
Well, I mean, I helped too.
All right, I think that might be going a little far.
Shhh, I can hear him coming!
Ciao! You must be the bold capitano I've heard so much about.
It is an honor, sir.
You're safe with us!
Wonderful, it has been a long journey. I think I'm going to help myself to dinner and retire for the night-
*ALARM*
I'm guessing that's not the dinner bell...
It's nothing for you to worry about, sir. We'll have it taken care of before dinner's been prepared.
@BATTLE
I'm glad to find you can handle yourself in battle, Capitano. I can see I have nothing to worry about while in your company.
Thank you, sir. I'm glad we could impress.
I have to ask, how come you didn't choose Lorenzo for this mission?
Capitano Lorenzo is a strong leader. He may be arrogant, but his ship is powerful enough to defend against attacks from sky and sea.
I'm hoping there's a "but" here?
No, there's not. The only reason I didn't choose Lorenzo for this mission was Fiorenza's betrayal.
Giving her everything she wanted after all that she did... the idea left an unpleasant taste in my mouth.
So if Fiorenza hadn't betrayed the Regia Marina?
The choice would've been simple, but what's done is done. I'm in need of a good rest. Good day to you both.
That's ironic. Fiorenza should've just had more faith, huh?
I should've known I wasn't his first pick.
Are you all right, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I'm fine. I'm used to not being picked first.
I'm disappointed, but I can't let it get to me.
Is it all right if I curl into a ball and cry?

Fields.DialogueText: You wanna play some football or something? I'll pick you first.
We might not have been his first choice, but we were his final one. Focus on that.
No! That's not all right! That is not how a capitano should act!
*ALARM*
You know what that means.
It's still not the dinner bell.
@BATTLE
Capitano... we're friends now, right?
Of course we're friends, Bolzano. Why?
Well, I was looking for a little advice. You know, friend to friend.
I'm nothing if not a font of advice. What's bothering you?
Do you think someone like Lorenzo would ever go for a girl like me?

Fields.MenuText: You have a beautiful spirit and a strong heart. He'd be crazy not to go for you.
Oh, great! Are you the next crazy fan? Should I start keeping an eye out for more bombs?
Compliment his choice of hairspray and he's yours.

Fields.DialogueText: You're going to make me blush!
I'm not gonna blow anything up! I'm not obsessed with him or nothing.
You think that would work? I could give it a try.
Are you seriously interested in him, Bolzano?
No... Yes? I don't know. It's just a little crush. He is pretty charming.
Just don't be fooled by his looks. There's something off about him.
@BATTLE
I hope you're wrong, but we don't have time to argue it. Cattive Ragazze approaching, Capitano!
Capitano! I received word this morning of an incident I believe you should be aware of.
An incident? I don't like the sound of that.
The prison holding Fiorenza fell under siege this morning. There were no survivors...
No survivors? What about her?
Her body wasn't found, but there was a lot of rubble. She could just as easily be-
No, she's alive. I'm sure she orchestrated some elaborate extraction. At the cost of more Regia Marina lives, it would seem.
We're on the same page then. You've had personal dealings with her. Do you have any idea how she could've done this?

Fields.MenuText: I had nothing to do with it, if that's what you're implying.
Well, she's familiar with bombs. Learned that the hard way.
It's not like we were best friends. You were her boss, right? Wouldn't you know her better?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you didn't. It never hurts to make sure, though.
Unless she knows how to make straw bedding and stones into explosives, I doubt she blew her way out.
I'm many people's boss. I don't know everyone that works under me personally.
If Fiorenza is behind this... then we need to anticipate her next move.
*ALARM*
Well, at least she has to deal with the Morganas, too. She shouldn't get very far.
@BATTLE
The news of Fiorenza's escape is rather unsettling, Capitano.
Yes, it is... but we have to keep our mind on the task at hand. We have a senator to protect.
In my eyes she's the bigger threat. Alone, she almost destroyed the ship. You should never underestimate the power of love.
Watch out! COMING THROUGH!
Again with the bicycle! You're going to kill me with that thing one day!
Don't be so dramatic! And use her name already. I know you know it.

Fields.MenuText: We've talked about this, Bolzano. Eyes open.
She may be a bit of a safety hazard, Amadeo, but you have to admit she's pretty fast.
Bolzano, don't make me regret fixing Nicolina.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Capitano. I'll pay more attention next time.
The fastest in all the Italian Alps! Maybe even the world! Oh, I like the sound of that!
Shh... Nicolina doesn't like when you say things like that!
I think you owe Amadeo an apology.
Nicolina and I are sorry. We'll try to give you a wide berth next time.
It scares me a little when you refer to that bicycle as a living person.
You'll change your tune after we win the Tour de France.
Ha! That would be the day.
Hmph! No faith. We'll show him someday, Nicolina.
*ALARM*
We've got Morganas. That's something you could win today, Bolzano.
Rude!
@BATTLE
And the time after that.
And the time after that...
Capitano, you have a moment?
Depends on whether or not you're about to lust over Lorenzo.
Aren't you full of jokes.
Sure. Joking. That's what I was doing. So what did you want?
I've been training a lot lately. A lot. An excessive amount... but Amadeo thinks the idea of me competing in the Tour de France was ridiculous. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I think you could do a whole lot more than just compete. You'd dominate.
This is your pressing question? We're fighting a war. Against alien battleships. That's a little more important than a bike race.
Amadeo has a point. The people who compete in the Tour de France are the best of the best.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, obviously. I'm glad you agree.
The Tour de France isn't just some bike race. It's THE bike race.
Which is exactly why I should be racing in it. Have you seen me? I'm the best of the best.
If it makes you happy, then we can always try to enter you into the Tour de France, all right? But only after the war is over.
Those are two things easier said than done. But I appreciate the thought, Capitano.
I just want to say-
Wait, I sense danger.
Morganas?
*ALARM*
What do you think?
@BATTLE
We have company! Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Capitano, I was told you wanted to see me?
I just wanted you to come join me on deck. You spend too much time inside. A little ocean spray can do you wonders.
The taste of the ocean makes me sick.

Fields.MenuText: Have we finally found your one true weakness? Here I thought you didn't let anything affect you.
But look how beautiful it is out here. How can something so gorgeous make you sick?
Huh? Did you get drafted during happy hour or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I have plenty of weaknesses. I'm not invulnerable.
I feel about the ocean in a similar way that you feel about Capitano Lorenzo. It's nice to look at, but my gut doesn't agree with it.
It's a long story... It was dark, I was hungry, the guy had a fun hat.
And here I thought I knew everything there was to know about you.
You learn something new every day.
That a ship on the horizon... I've seen it somewhere.
It looks familiar. It could be Capitano Loren-
*BOOM*
Capitano! Watch out!
Ungh... Amadeo...
We're under attack! Amadeo?
Lorenzo's ship just fired on us! What is going on?
Get ready for battle! Amadeo, sound the alarm!
Uh, Capitano... I... Officer Amadeo isn't responding... I think... I think he's gone.
Amadeo! Wake up!
Capitano...
Bolzano, get a medic. We can't just give up!
All right, I will, but... Lorenzo's preparing to board. You need to gather the crew.
Oh, I'll gather the crew all right. Someone's gonna pay.
It's nice to be back on board!
Fiorenza?! What's the meaning of this!?
Lorenzo, my love, please silence il Senatore.
Anything for you, my sweet.
Mmphm!!!
You wretched bastards!
I'm sorry we had to meet again under these circumstances, Capitano. Giovanni is simply too valuable to us. We couldn't just leave him in your hands.
Again, you've bitten off more than you can chew, Fiorenza. Leave the Senator here and run while you still have the chance.
Oh? You're trying to bargain now? You see my ship out there? One word from me and it'll send your darling little ship to the bottom of the sea.
So I'd watch what you say if I were you.
I understand why you're doing this, Fiorenza. You're insane, but why are you helping her, Lorenzo?
That is none of your concern, Capitano. Our motives are our own.
I've already gotten in trouble once from talking too much. I learn from my mistakes. Now, I really must be on my way. Come, Giovanni!
Mmphm!!!
Capitano... I'm so sorry. Officer Amadeo didn't make it.
Lorenzo, you traitorous piece of trash! You did this!
This is war. He's just one of many casualties. You can't cry over every single one.

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to kill you.
You're just her puppet. You know that, right?
Coward! Amadeo will be avenged!

Fields.DialogueText: Do your best, but many more capable capitani have already tried and failed.
She's my ocean pearl. We're in this together.
Don't be so dramatic. It's not like I was aiming for the poor man.
I can't believe I ever thought you were attractive! You're hideous beyond words.
Hideous? You don't think that's a little harsh? I just bought this tie.
You're disgusting and your hair is greasy!
Take that back or I'll sink your ship!
And it's not grease! I use a complex blend of olive oil and lavender to get this magnificent sheen.
We get it! You take your hair seriously. Congrats.
It doesn't matter if you don't get it. The Morganas will be here to finish you off soon.
He's right. We have Morganas approaching fast!
What great timing...
@BATTLE
Capitano...
I came to see how you're holding up.
This hasn't been easy on any of us. The crew morale is low.
I failed. I couldn't protect anyone.
There was nothing you could have done. No one could have anticipated-
The Senator's been captured. Amadeo is dead. The ship's damaged... and the two traitors responsible are at large. Sounds like a failure to me.
Do you know what it means to be a leader?
A pep talk? Seriously?
Anyone can call themselves a leader on a good day, but when everything around them is breaking, when nightmares become reality... the true leaders stand and overcome.
Does this sound like you, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I used to think so. Clearly I was wrong.
That's a stupid question. This whole conversation is stupid.
You tell me.

Fields.DialogueText: You weren't wrong. In fact, you're the only one that saw Lorenzo for the snake he was.
It's not as stupid as just sitting around and sulking when there's still something you can do.
I can't tell you. You have to answer this question on your own.
I've made mistakes... but you're right. I'm still the captain. And I'll lead us through this adversity.
*ALARM*
Then get up and prove it.
@BATTLE
Capitano! We have a problem.
Report.
News of Giovanni and his capture are all over the newspapers. Italy is in a panic.
We're going to get him back. And Fiorenza and Lorenzo will spend the rest of their miserable lives far apart in two separate prisons on opposite sides of the country.
Glad to have you back! Now what's our plan of attack? We have no idea where they are.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, that's a hard one. I just got back on the horse. Throw me an easy one first.
Sit and wait. They will come to us.
How well does Nicolina handle in the water?

Fields.DialogueText: What? Like, what's for dinner or something?
That's not much of a plan, if you ask me.
This isn't time for jokes, Capitano!
Fiorenza said that Giovanni was valuable to them. She might be planning to demand a ransom.
That's certainly possible.
Until then... I think our only real option is to wait. We need them to make the next move.
Well... I suppose that'll give me more time to train with Nicolina. You still promised to get me into the Tour de France, remember?
How could I forget? Train while you can. I have a feeling we won't be drifting for long before we garner the attention of some Morganas.
I believe we already have!
@BATTLE
We have a weak signal coming over the radio!
And Morganas coming over the horizon, Bolzano.
It's a repeating message, so let's deal with our enemies first.
@BATTLE
Finally. Is the signal still going?
Come listen for yourself.
*STATIC*
Adjust the signal. I can barely hear.
Capitano... Care to chat? Giovanni is alive...
Give me the radio!
Return the Senator, Fiorenza!
Ah, there you are, Capitano... I was worried you'd never get our signal.
What do you want?
If you want to see him again... ten million lira will be the price.
You're out of your mind!
We'll chat soon. I suggest you be in a more charitable mood by then.
Capitano, we pinpointed their location. I suggest we call the Regia Aeronautica to rain hell from the sky.

Fields.MenuText: We'd be raining hell on the Senator, too.
Destroy them all!
Tell them to disable the cannons so we can get close.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. I meant to say we should have them disable the cannons so we can get close.
Wait, we need to save the Senator, remember? We should probably just have them disable the cannons instead, right?
Good plan, Capitano!
Send word to the air force. We'll be needing their assistance at their location.
You got it!
I have some bad news, Capitano.
It would seem we have bad news in spades. What is it this time?
The airstrike wasn't as effective as we hoped. Lorenzo fought them all off.
Powerful enough to defend against attacks from sky and sea. Just like Giovanni said. Lorenzo's ship is powerful.
We need to get up close, past his cannons, and find a weak point. There's no way we're winning a fair fight.

Fields.MenuText: I hope that means you have a plan.
Sounds like a death sentence to me.
I've got a few ideas that could work. It's gonna be dangerous, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... not quite. Not yet! I'm working on it.
Don't be such a wimp. We're faster than him. That's what counts.
Well, I don't think a safe plan is going to work at this point. Not with who we're dealing with.
*ALARM*
Morganas. At least they're a predictable enemy.
Predictable? So you were anticipating them coming out of nowhere and declaring war on all mankind?
Well... No.
I didn't think so. Nothing's predictable. Boop!
Did you just tap my nose?
Just being unpredictable. Now, come on. We've got Morganas to deal with!
@BATTLE
Capitano! We're receiving another transmission from Lorenzo's ship!
What are you waiting for? Turn it up!
Capitano! Capitano! Can you hear me? Capitano! Come in!
Copy! Senator, is that you? How-
I'm not just some frail old man. I have my methods. I needed to tell you something. Quickly, before they find me.
I'm listening, sir.
Lorenzo stores explosives on the lower stern of his ship. A little too close to the hull. A direct hit should be able to set them off.
I like it. Give Fiorenza a taste of what she put Nicolina through.
Sir, can you give us a precise location? If we miss we-
He's here! Remember, aim for the lower stern-
Ah! So this is where you ran off to. I'll teach you not to make that mistake again. Get over here!
The signal went dead, Capitano! What's our next move?

Fields.MenuText: We have a weak spot. Let's take advantage of it.
We need to get the Senator off that boat before we even think about blowing it up.
I think you said it best. Let's give Fiorenza a taste of her own medicine.

Fields.DialogueText: I like the enthusiasm!
Obviously! I mean, I totally wasn't thinking about blowing it up anyway. Totally!
For Nicolina.
Let's make contact with Lorenzo and tell him we have their money. However, we have to demand that the exchange take place on our ship.
To get Giovanni to safety. But where are we getting all that money?
Let me worry about that. I've got a plan.
@BATTLE
Bolzano. I see you're back in the land of tools?
I haven't been down here for that long. Have I? What time is it? What day is it?
Yeah... I think it's time you came up for some fresh air.
I'm sorry. I just started working on Nicolina and... I guess I got a little wrapped up.
I'll say. Those guns you attached look like they could take on a small fleet.
I was thinking about how Amadeo wanted to add more defenses to the ship at the cost of our speed.
With the extra weight, Nicolina might not be quite as fast, but I think Amadeo would approve. Don't you?
I'm sure he would. He only wanted everyone to be safe. And it definitely looks like she'd keep you safe in the Tour de France.
I might not be fast enough to win, though.

Fields.MenuText: This is Nicolina we're talking about. Even with the extra weight, she'll be sure to go the extra mile.
When it comes to you, Bolzano, literally anything is possible.
The fun isn't in the victory. It's in the competition, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, stop, you're going to make her blush.
I had no idea you had such a high opinion of me, Capitano. I'm flattered.
Mmm... Yeah, but it'd be nice to win, too...
Imagining you and your heavily armed bike riding through France is entertaining, but don't we have more important things on our plate right now?
You're right. Plus, we've got Morganas approaching.
*ALARM*
You took your sweet time telling me that. Come on, let's get ready for battle.
@BATTLE
Capitano!
Report.
We established contact with Lorenzo's ship.

Fields.MenuText: Great. The conversation I've been dreading with my least favorite person.
About time. This whole situation has been going on too long.
I don't know whom I'd rather have on the other end less: Fiorenza or Lorenzo.

Fields.DialogueText: It's either talk to them or let them keep the Senator. I'm not a huge fan or anything, but I'm pretty sure a lot of people would be pissed if we didn't get him back.
You're right. It's about time we finished this.
Personally, I'd rather deal with Fiorenza. I honestly think, between the two of them, she's less crazy.
Let's get this over with.
Fiorenza? Do you copy, Fiorenza?
Ah! We meet again...
We have your cash. Now before you so much as smell it, we're going to need proof of life.
All business now, are you? Il senatore is fine. See for yourself.
Help! Get me out of here, please!
He certainly sounds alive... and scared.
I don't know what he's so afraid of. We've been treating him very nicely. Though that could always change if we don't get our money.
It's right here. Come and get it, and bring Giovanni.
I see... you want to do the trade on your ship.
Will that be a problem?
Of course not. We'll be there before you know it. With our cannons loaded in case you try anything funny.
Same goes for us.
*ALARM*
As much as I'd like to keep chatting, we've got more important things to deal with than you.
Excuse me?! Do you think you-
Oooh, you pissed her off.
That was the goal. Now let's get going. We've got Morganas to deal with.
@BATTLE
Are those Lorenzo's guns? Are they attacking us?
I think that's just the Morganas, Capitano.
"Just" them? Ugh, this has surely done a number on our priorities. Get ready!
@BATTLE
Capitano, Lorenzo's ship is approaching. This is it.
Heh, it really could be if our plan fails.
It won't fail. It's a good plan. I trust you, Capitano.
Thank you, Bolzano.
It's been an honor serving the Regia Marina under your leadership. And it's been an even greater honor being your friend.

Fields.MenuText: When you say it like that, it seems like you don't plan on making it out of this alive.
We've had a good run, haven't we?
You're being really emotional right now. Should I give you some space or something? You're making me uncomfortable.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I know we'll both be returning to Italy alive. You've still got to get me into the Tour de France, remember?
I think it's been a little bit more than all right, but maybe that's just me.
That does it! I'm going to hug you now! Come here, give me a hug!
*BOOM*
Are we inside their range yet?
No. We're safe. I think Lorenzo was just letting us know that they were here in the loudest way possible.
Yeah, that seems like something he'd do. Let's get ready. It's almost over.
Hello, good afternoon, and all those other pleasantries.
Where's Fiorenza?
She elected to stay behind. Someone has to keep my cannons aimed squarely on your jaw, Capitano.
If she shoots at us now, you'll be caught in the blast too. I guess love really is deaf, dumb, and blind.
Hush. Your input is no longer important. Please, is there any chance we could do this in a more private setting? Without certain aggravating parties.
Oh, I'M too aggravating for YOU?! You're lucky I don't have Nicolina with me. She'd have shot you full of holes before you even stepped on deck.

Fields.MenuText: Bolzano, let's dial down the antagonizing attitude, please.
You should meet her, Lorenzo. She's one woman your wiles won't work on.
You've got some pluck, Lorenzo. Walking onto my ship and making demands.

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. Why not just dial it all the way down to zero, shall we?
Impossible. My wiles work on everyone with a pulse.
In case you've forgotten, I hold all the cards here. Or do I need to give you another demonstration with my massive cannons?
Bolzano... can you leave us for a moment?
Oh!
Actually, we were thinking of something more neutral. There's a small island not far from here. It's the perfect place for a trade like this, don't you think?
All right, Bolzano, you stay here. You're in charge until I return. Understood?
Understood. Loud and clear.
Excellent. Now, let's go see il senatore. I'm sure he misses you.
*ALARM*
Dammit, is this your doing?
You give me too much credit. I can't control the Morganas anymore than I can control my love for my darling. Though it would seem you should deal with them before we continue.
It won't take long. I'll meet you on the island.
Take your time. I'm sure I can find some way to entertain myself with Giovanni.
@BATTLE
Give me a good reason why I shouldn't end you here and now.
I believe you have other priorities at the moment.
Like what?
*BOOM*
Like that.
@BATTLE
Bravo, Capitano. You handled that surprisingly well. It's a shame we're at odds like this. We could've been companions in another life.
I really doubt that. You don't seem like the kind of person that makes friends. Where's Giovanni?
So impatient. It's almost as if you don't trust me.
Oh, thank the Lord, it's you. I've so thankful to see someone besides this obnoxious buffoon.
Words hurt, sir. Do I need to remind you what else can hurt?
Are you all right, Senator?
No! It's been horrible. Lorenzo and Fiorenza... They were clearly making up for lost time. You don't even want to know the things I've seen.
I think the old man is jealous. What do you think, Capitano?
I think you can put down the weapon. I have your money right here.
Oh, this? Just a flare gun. The actual guns are back on my ship. Aimed at yours. Now give me the briefcase or my beloved will send your ship to the depths.
You're not the only one with cannons, Lorenzo.
I would've thought you'd have realized that those puny things are useless compared to mine. Now... Hand over the money!

Fields.MenuText: It's all right here. More money than you could spend in five lifetimes.
Looks like I'm not the only impatient one.
All right, but I should warn you. Looks can be deceiving.

Fields.DialogueText: Underestimating me again, it would seem. My pearl has expensive tastes.
Every moment I spend here with you is one less I'm spending with my darling Fiorenza.
What is that supposed to mean? Did you draw funny faces on the money or something?
What is this? Is this a joke? This suitcase is just full of hair grease. Where's the money?
I wasn't smart enough to bring a flare gun, but I think I predicted you correctly.
I don't know what you think you're doing, but say goodbye to Bolzano.
*BOOM*
What the hell?! Impossible! My ship... sinking! And my Fiorenza!
Excellent work!
Fiorenza...
Ah. You're just accepting your fate, I see.
Lorenzo, watch your own ship right now.
Everything... Everything is gone. You've taken everything from me...
A deserving fate for a traitor!
Don't forget that you started it, you slime.
How did this happen?

Fields.MenuText: I'd say next time be more careful about where you store your explosives, but... I doubt there will be a next time, traitor.
You know the story of Achilles, right? Well, we found his heel.
Bolzano's greatest strength is her speed, and mine is my luck. It's a powerful combination.

Fields.DialogueText: Idiots. I told them to put it somewhere safe. I'm glad they're dead.
Then I'll find your weakness, too. This isn't over.
Luck? You expect me to believe that? Nonsense!
It doesn't matter, Lorenzo. You've lost. And now you'll spend the rest of your life in a cell.
No! I can't go to prison... I'm too pretty to be in such a place!
Don't worry, you won't be pretty for long. You won't have access to all your beauty products.
Just kill me. I can't bear to be apart from my love. Send me to join her.
That'd be too easy. Your pain should last longer. For Amadeo.
*ALARM*
Capitano, we've got company.
Take him away. Store him somewhere nice and safe. We wouldn't want him getting hurt before he gets to his prison sentence.
@BATTLE
We've arrived, Senator, sir!
And in one piece!
The country owes you both a massive debt. And my thanks.
Not too bad for your second choice, huh?
Especially considering your first choice kidnapped and tortured you.
Sì. If not for you, I would not be standing here today. If there's anything I can do for you, to return the favor, please just let me know.
Actually... you know, there is something you could do for Bolzano.
For me?
She's keen to be a competitor in the Tour de France. Think you could help her with that?
Capitano!
Bolzano is quite the athlete, but the situation is... tense with France at the moment. I'm not sure I can grant that now, but I promise you that after the war, we will find a way.
Really!? Thank you so much! I will make sure Nicolina is ready for action!

Fields.MenuText: I seriously doubt they're gonna let you ride that tank you call a bicycle, Bolzano.
I told you we could get you in somehow.
Seriously? That worked? Wasn't expecting that.

Fields.DialogueText: Shut up! A girl can dream!
Don't pretend like you were planning this all along, Capitano.
Of course it worked. Il senatore is a very kind, gracious man. And so handsome, too!
I really must be going, but I'd love to have you both for dinner when I get back to Italy. I'm thinking Bolzano may be a fitting destination.
Are you talking about me or my namesake?
Heh, your namesake. It seems as fitting a place as any to award the medal of bravery to the two of you.
Seriously? I don't know what to say.
Say you'll accept.
Of course I do.
Fantastic. Now wish me luck with this conference. Hopefully we'll be able to come to a few decisions regarding the Morganas.
Goodbye! Good luck with your super boring talks!
Bolzano, shush!
Heheh, they are boring, aren't they? Now, those girls currently aiming their cannons at us; that's where the real excitement is.
@BATTLE
You think Amadeo's looking down on us right now?
He better be. And he better be seething and embarrassed about being so wrong. I'm going to be in the Tour de France!
That'll really be something. It's a shame Amadeo won't be there to see it in person.
Oh, he'll be watching. He'd better be. And you better be, too!

Fields.MenuText: Of course I'll be there. I wouldn't miss it for the world.
Eh, I'm not sure. Watching a bike race seems kind of boring.
Watching? I'll be participating.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I like to hear. I need you cheering me on.
Boring? You've clearly never watched the Tour de France before. It gets intense.
Participating? Good luck with that. You already called in your favor with Senator Giovanni to get my spot.
Hey... Do you feel better about Amadeo now that you've avenged him?
Honestly? No. I still miss him. I think I always will.
Oh. I'm sorry, Capitano.
Don't be. Just keep smiling. Haven't you ever heard that the smile of a friend is contagious?
I think I've heard that once or twice. But is there really nothing I can do to cheer you up a little?
There's no need, Bolzano. I don't think I'll ever forget about Amadeo, but I know he's in a better place now. Somewhere he doesn't have to fight a war against Morganas.
Speaking of...
Morganas approaching?
Yup. Think we can finish them quick?
I'm pretty sure that's the only way you do things.
Great! Then afterwards we can start training. I've gotta get in better shape if I'm gonna compete against the pros!
@BATTLE
You know that you...
Can't actually race, because I can't go more than a few meters from the ship?
Right. That.
I'll deal with that problem later. Maybe after the war, we'll have a solution - and I don't want to be out of shape for the Tour de France when that day comes!
Hey, Bolzano. The pros won't know what hit them.
Hehe. Grazie, Capitano.
